010package imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.linear;
011
012import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
013import imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.AffineFit2D;
014import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
015import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
016
017/**
018 * This class represents an affine transformation in 2D, which can be defined 
019 * by three pairs of corresponding points.
020 * It can be assumed that every instance of this class is indeed an affine mapping.
021 */
022public class AffineMapping2D extends ProjectiveMapping2D {
023
024        /**
025         * Creates an affine 2D mapping from two sequences of corresponding points.
026         * If 3 point pairs are specified, the mapping is exact, otherwise a
027         * minimum least-squares fit is calculated.
028         * @param P the source points
029         * @param Q the target points
030         * @return a new {@link AffineMapping2D} instance for the two point sets
031         */
032        public static AffineMapping2D fromPoints(Pnt2d[] P, Pnt2d[] Q) {
033                if (P.length != Q.length) {
034                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("point sets P, Q must have the same size");
035                }
036                if (P.length < 3) {
037                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("at least 3 point pairs are required");
038                }
039                if (P.length == 3) {
040                        // exact fit
041                        return fromPoints(P[0], P[1], P[2], Q[0], Q[1], Q[2]);
042                }
043                else {
044                        // minimum least-squares fit
045                        AffineFit2D fit = new AffineFit2D(P, Q);
046                        return new AffineMapping2D(fit.getTransformationMatrix());
047                }
048        }
049        
050        /**
051         * <p>
052         * Creates an affine mapping from 3 pairs of corresponding 2D points
053         * (p0, p1, p2) &rarr; (q0, q1, q2).
054         * The solution is found in closed form (see [1], Sec. 21.1.3, eq. 21.31).
055         * </p>
056         * <p>
057         * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
058         * </p>
059         * 
060         * @param p0 point 1 of source triangle A
061         * @param p1 point 2 of source triangle A
062         * @param p2 point 3 of source triangle A
063         * @param q0 point 1 of source triangle B
064         * @param q1 point 2 of source triangle B
065         * @param q2 point 3 of source triangle B
066         * @return a new {@link AffineMapping2D} instance
067         */
068        public static AffineMapping2D fromPoints(Pnt2d p0, Pnt2d p1, Pnt2d p2, Pnt2d q0, Pnt2d q1, Pnt2d q2) {
069                final double px0 = p0.getX(), px1 = p1.getX(), px2 = p2.getX();
070                final double py0 = p0.getY(), py1 = p1.getY(), py2 = p2.getY();
071                final double qx0 = q0.getX(), qx1 = q1.getX(), qx2 = q2.getX();
072                final double qy0 = q0.getY(), qy1 = q1.getY(), qy2 = q2.getY();
073
074                final double d = px0 * (py2 - py1) + px1 * (py0 - py2) + px2 * (py1 - py0); 
075                if (Arithmetic.isZero(d)) {
076                        throw new ArithmeticException("affine mapping is undefined (d=0)");
077                }
078                double a00 = (py0 * (qx1 - qx2) + py1 * (qx2 - qx0) + py2 * (qx0 - qx1)) / d;
079                double a01 = (px0 * (qx2 - qx1) + px1 * (qx0 - qx2) + px2 * (qx1 - qx0)) / d;
080                double a10 = (py0 * (qy1 - qy2) + py1 * (qy2 - qy0) + py2 * (qy0 - qy1)) / d;
081                double a11 = (px0 * (qy2 - qy1) + px1 * (qy0 - qy2) + px2 * (qy1 - qy0)) / d;
082                
083                double a02 = (px0*(py2*qx1-py1*qx2) + px1*(py0*qx2-py2*qx0) + px2*(py1*qx0-py0*qx1)) / d;
084                double a12 = (px0*(py2*qy1-py1*qy2) + px1*(py0*qy2-py2*qy0) + px2*(py1*qy0-py0*qy1)) / d;
085                
086                return new AffineMapping2D(a00, a01, a02, a10, a11, a12);
087        }
088        
089//      /**
090//       * Creates an affine mapping from an arbitrary 2D triangle A to another triangle B.
091//       * @param A the first triangle
092//       * @param B the second triangle
093//       * @return a new affine mapping
094//       * @deprecated
095//       */
096//      public static AffineMapping2D from3Points(Point[] A, Point[] B) {
097//              return AffineMapping2D.from3Points(A[0], A[1], A[2], B[0], B[1], B[2]);
098//      }
099        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
100        
101        /**
102         * Creates the identity mapping.
103         */
104        public AffineMapping2D() {
105                super();
106        }
107        
108        /**
109         * Creates a linear mapping from a transformation matrix A,
110         * which must be at least of size 2 x 3.
111         * The elements of A are copied into a 3x3 identity matrix.
112         * If A is larger than 2 x 3, the remaining elements are ignored.
113         * @param A a 2x3 (or larger) matrix
114         */
115        public AffineMapping2D(double[][] A) {
116                //super(A[0][0], A[0][1], A[0][2], A[1][0], A[1][1], A[1][2], 0, 0);
117                super(extractAffineMatrix(A));
118        }
119        
120        private static double[][] extractAffineMatrix(double[][] A) {
121                double[][] M = Matrix.idMatrix(3);
122                final int m = Math.min(2, A.length);    // max. 2 rows
123                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
124                        final int n = Math.min(3, A[i].length); // max. 3 columns
125                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
126                                M[i][j] = A[i][j];
127                        }
128                }
129                return M;
130        }
131
132        /**
133         * Creates an affine mapping from the specified matrix elements.
134         * @param a00 matrix element A_00
135         * @param a01 matrix element A_01
136         * @param a02 matrix element A_02
137         * @param a10 matrix element A_10
138         * @param a11 matrix element A_11
139         * @param a12 matrix element A_12
140         */
141        public AffineMapping2D (
142                        double a00, double a01, double a02, 
143                        double a10, double a11, double a12) {
144                super(a00, a01, a02, a10, a11, a12, 0, 0);
145        }
146
147        /**
148         * Creates a new affine mapping from an existing affine mapping.
149         * @param m an affine mapping
150         */
151        public AffineMapping2D(AffineMapping2D m) {
152                this(m.a00, m.a01, m.a02, m.a10, m.a11, m.a11);
153        }
154        
155        // ----------------------------------------------------------
156        
157        /** Deviation limit for checking 0 and 1 values. */
158        protected static double AffineTolerance = 1e-15;
159        
160        /**
161         * Checks if the given linear mapping could be affine, i.e. if the
162         * bottom row of its transformation matrix is (0, 0, 1). 
163         * Note that this is a necessary but not sufficient requirement.
164         * The threshold {@link AffineTolerance} is used in this check.
165         * @param map a linear mapping
166         * @return true if the mapping could be affine
167         */
168        public static boolean isAffine(LinearMapping2D map) {
169                if (Math.abs(map.a20) > AffineTolerance) return false;
170                if (Math.abs(map.a21) > AffineTolerance) return false;
171                if (Math.abs(map.a22 - 1.0) > AffineTolerance) return false;
172                return true;
173        }
174
175        /**
176         * Concatenates this mapping A with another affine mapping B and returns
177         * a new mapping C, such that C(x) = B(A(x)).
178         * @param B the second mapping
179         * @return the concatenated affine mapping
180         */
181        public AffineMapping2D concat(AffineMapping2D B) {      // use some super method instead?
182                double[][] C = Matrix.multiply(B.getTransformationMatrix(), this.getTransformationMatrix());
183                return new AffineMapping2D(C[0][0], C[0][1], C[0][2], C[1][0], C[1][1], C[1][2]);
184        }
185
186        /**
187         * {@inheritDoc}
188         * Note that inverting an affine transformation always yields
189         * another affine transformation.
190         */
191        @Override
192        public AffineMapping2D getInverse() {
193                double det = a00 * a11 - a01 * a10;
194                double b00 = a11 / det;
195                double b01 = -a01 / det;
196                double b02 = (a01 * a12 - a02 * a11) / det;
197                double b10 = -a10 / det;
198                double b11 = a00 / det;
199                double b12 = (a02 * a10 - a00 * a12) / det;
200                return new AffineMapping2D(b00, b01, b02, b10, b11, b12);
201        }
202
203        /**
204         * {@inheritDoc}
205         * @return a new affine mapping
206         */
207        @Override
208        public AffineMapping2D duplicate() {
209                return new AffineMapping2D(this);
210        }
211
212        @Override
213        public double[][] getJacobian(Pnt2d xy) {
214                final double x = xy.getX();
215                final double y = xy.getY();
216                return new double[][]
217                        {{x, y, 0, 0, 1, 0},
218                         {0, 0, x, y, 0, 1}};
219        }
220        
221        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
222        
223//      /**

233//              System.out.println("a = \n" + Matrix.toString(A));
234//              System.out.println();

236//              System.out.println("ai = \n" + Matrix.toString(ai));
237//              
238//              LinearMapping2D Ai = new LinearMapping2D(ai);
239//              System.out.println("Ai is affine: " + isAffine(Ai));
240//              
241//              double[][] I = Matrix.multiply(A, ai);
242//              System.out.println("\ntest: should be the  identity matrix: = \n" + Matrix.toString(I));
243//              
244//              double[][] B = 
245//                      {{-2, 4, -3}, 
246//                      {3, 7, 2}};
247//

249//              System.out.println("an = \n" + Matrix.toString(am.getTransformationMatrix()));
250//      }
251
252}
